Check eligibility, application form details, qualifications, online apply date, anganwadi vacancy list district wise and start your career in Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS). Download Anganwadi Form 2025 now at icds.gov.in and stay updated on Anganwadi latest recruitment notifications. Stay updated with the latest Anganwadi job notifications from all states, including Karnataka, TN, Telangana, UP, AP, Maharashtra, Bihar and more Anganwadi Recruitment 2025 - Overview Category Details Recruitment Name Anganwadi Recruitment 2025 Conducted By State Governments under ICDS Scheme Available Posts Anganwadi Worker, Helper, Mini Worker, Supervisor Educational Qualification Worker/Mini Worker: 10th Pass Helper: 8th Pass Supervisor: Graduate Age Limit 18 to 35/40 years (varies by state) Application Mode Offline / Online (state-wise) Selection Process Merit-based on academic marks, document verification, interview Required Documents Educational Certificates, ID Proof, Address Proof, Photo, Caste Certificate Who Can Apply for Anganwadi Job Vacancy 2025? The Ministry of Women and Child Development (WCD) has defined clear eligibility criteria for candidates who wish to apply for various Anganwadi posts across India. These guidelines ensure that suitable and qualified individuals are selected for the welfare and development of children and women at the grassroots level Gender : Both male and female candidates are eligible to apply for Anganwadi job roles Age Limit: Applicants must be at least 18 years old and not older than 40 years (age relaxation may apply as per government norms) Educational Qualification: Minimum Qualification: 10th pass from a recognized board Higher Posts: Candidates applying for Supervisor or Officer-level posts should have a graduate degree or qualifications relevant to the post Residential Status: The applicant must be a permanent resident of the respective state/district where the vacancy is announced Language Proficiency: Must be able to read, write, and speak the local language of the region where applying Documents Required for Anganwadi Application Make sure to keep the following documents ready at the time of application: Document Purpose Aadhar Card Identity verification Domicile Certificate Proof of residence in the respective state or district Caste Certificate To claim reservation benefits (if applicable) Educational Certificates Proof of academic qualifications Passport Size Photo For use in application form Mobile Number For communication and updates Email ID To receive official communication (if required) Signature For form submission and verification Anganwadi Selection Process 2025 The selection process for Anganwadi jobs is mostly merit-based and conducted by the respective State Women and Child Development (WCD) departments. Here's how it works Application Submission: Candidates need to fill and submit the Anganwadi application form along with all required documents before the deadline, either online or offline as per their state Document Verification: After applications are received, officials verify the submitted documents like educational certificates, identity proof, domicile certificate, and caste certificate (if applicable) Merit List Preparation: Based on the marks obtained in 8th, 10th, or 12th standard (depending on the post), a merit list is prepared. No written examination is usually conducted for Worker and Helper posts Interview (if applicable): Some states may conduct a short interview for final verification or for supervisor-level posts Final Selection: The final list of selected candidates is published on the district’s official WCD website or notice board. Selected candidates may also receive a call or SMS regarding joining formalities. The step-by-step process is explained below: Visit the official website: www.grse.in Click on the "Officer Recruitment 2025" notification link Read the complete notification carefully Click on "Apply Online" button Register using email ID and mobile number Fill in personal, educational, and other details Upload required documents (PDF/JPG, max size as per instructions) Pay the application fee online Submit the form and save/print the confirmation page Officer Application Fee 2025 Category Application Fee General/EWS/OBC Rs. 590 SC/ST/PwD/Women Nil Payment Mode Online (Debit Card/Credit Card/Net Banking/UPI) Officer Recruitment 2025 - Important Links Document/Link Link Official Notification PDF Download PDF Apply Online Apply Here Official Website https://www.grse.in Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1. salary: Rs. 4500 will be directly credited to the Apprentices Bank account through DBT mode as per extant guidelines. Age Limit (as on 01-12-2025) Minimum Age—21 years Maximum Age -28 years [i.e. candidates must have been born not earlier than 01.12.1997 and not later than 01.12.2004 (both days inclusive)] Relaxation in upper age limit is applicable as per Government of India guidelines for SC/ST/OBC/PwBD candidates. Important Dates Activity Date Online Application Starting Date 18.12.2025 Last date for applying “UNITED INDIA INSURANCE CO. LTD” 20.01.2026 Physical appearance for verification of documents of shortlisted candidates at various offices of United India Insurance Co Ltd Call letter will be sent through Registered Email ID Selection Process The shortlisting shall be carried out based on the percentage of marks (up to two decimal places) secured in the qualifying Graduate Degree Examination, subject to the candidate fulfilling all the prescribed eligibility criteria. Where the result of the qualifying examination is declared in the form of CGPA / OGPA / GPA, the same shall be converted into percentage by multiplying the obtained grade by a factor of 10 (ten), and such converted percentage shall be indicated in the online application form. In cases where two or more candidates secure the same percentage of marks, their position in the merit list shall be determined according to their date of birth, with the older candidate being placed higher in the order of merit. Shortlisted Candidates will be intimated through their registered Email IDs only. Shortlisted candidates will have to appear in person for verification of documents at various offices of United India Insurance Co Ltd, the details of which will be intimated in due course. The final engagement list will be prepared after verifying all the details entered by the respective candidate in the NATS portal against the original documents and shall be subject to the availability of vacancies in the respective state. General Information/Instructions Candidates should take utmost care to furnish the details while filling in application. Company reserves right to reject ineligible candidate's applications at any stage of the selection process. All correspondence will be made only on the email ID mentioned by the candidate in their online application form and same has to be kept active for receiving all communications from Company related to Apprenticeship Training program. Incomplete applications / applications without supporting documents will be rejected outright. Company takes no responsibility to receive/ collect any certificate/ document sent separately. The name of the candidate should be spelt correctly in the application as it appears in the certificates/ mark sheets. Any change/ alteration found may disqualify the candidature. Candidates are advised not to change their appearance till the engagement process is complete. Decision of the Company in all matters regarding eligibility of the candidate, the stages at which such scrutiny of eligibility is to be undertaken, the documents to be produced for the purpose of the conduct of selection and any other matter relating to selection process will be final and binding on the candidate. Company reserves the right to modify/ amend/ cancel any of the eligibility criteria and/or any other terms and conditions spelt out in this Notification. The shortlisted candidates are required to produce original documents pertaining to Age, Qualification, etc. for verification. If any candidate is found ineligible while verifying the documents, he / she shall not be allowed to join Apprenticeship Program. Mere submission of application and apparently fulfilling the criteria as prescribed in the advertisement do not entitle a candidate to be called for Apprenticeship program. Canvassing in any form for training seats will be treated as disqualification. In case it is detected at any stage of engagement of apprentice that a candidate does not fulfill the eligibility norms and/or that he has furnished any incorrect /false information or has suppressed any material fact(s), including in unfair practices in the process, his/her candidature will be cancelled. If any of these shortcomings is/are detected even after engagement, his/her contract of Apprenticeship Training is liable to be terminated without any compensation or claim whatsoever. Candidates in their own interest are advised to submit their applications well in time before the last date for submission and Company does not take any responsibility for the candidates not being able to submit their applications within the last date on account of the reasons beyond the control of the Company. Shortlisted candidates shall be required to produce all requisite original documents, along with self-attested photocopies, in support of their eligibility, educational qualification, and identity at the time of document verification. Failure to produce the required documents, at the time of verification shall render the candidate ineligible for further participation in the engagement process. Further, non-submission of requisite documents by the candidate at the time of engagement shall result in cancellation of candidature and debarment from any subsequent stage of the Apprenticeship engagement process. Candidates must ensure that the following documents are clearly uploaded in their NATS student profile: Degree Certificate, Provisional Certificate, Consolidated Mark sheet, Aadhaar Card, Bank Passbook (in the candidate's name), Latest Passport-size Photograph. Candidates must ensure that all details entered in the student profile match the information on their educational documents, including: Candidate's Name, Parents' Names, Aadhaar Number, Educational qualification. How to Apply For students who have already enrolled in the National Web Portal and having login details: Login, search for "UNITED INDIA INSURANCE COMPANY LTD" under "Apply against advertised vacancies", click apply. For first time enrollment: Go to https://nats.education.gov.in, click Student Register, complete form, get Enrollment Number, then login and apply as above. Upload the B.E / B.Tech/ B.A./ B.Sc., / B.Com.,/ BBA/ BCA etc., Provisional Certificate (or) Consolidated Mark Sheet. Percentage of marks in the Graduate / Non Engg, Graduate Examination is mandatory. Hence candidates are advised to compulsorily enter percentage of marks in the column "% of marks / CGPAx10" in the NATS portal.
